name: Pikachu
flavorText: When several of these Pokemon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon attacks Pikachu during your opponent's next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokemon ends this effect.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Electabuzz
flavorText: A wild Pokemon with a short temper. It is able to distinguish colors, and likes the color red.
Attack1Text: Whenever an attack does damage to Electabuzz (after applying Weakness and Resistance) during your opponent's next turn, that attack only does half the damage to Electabuzz (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

name: Mewtwo
flavorText: Years of genetic experiments resulted in the creation of this never-before-seen violent Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Choose up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Mewtwo.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: When several of these Pokemon gather, they attract so much electricity that they can cause lightning to strike.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Pikachu. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Pikachu in order to use this attack.

name: Dragonite
flavorText: This Pokemon can fly is spite of its large bulk. It is said to be able to circumnavigate the earth in just 16 hours.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card. If you do, choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. This power can't be used if Dragonite is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Arcanine
flavorText: A legendary Pokemon famous for its beauty. It looks almost as if it flies when it runs.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Fire Energy cards attached to Arcanine in order to use this attack. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Arcanine.

name: Jigglypuff
flavorText: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
Attack1Text: Remove 1 damage counter from Jigglypuff.
Attack2Text: Jigglypuff does 20 damage to itself.

name: Mew
flavorText: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Choose an evolved Pokemon (your own or your opponent's). Return the highest Stage Evolution card on that Pokemon to its player's hand. That Pokemon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned, or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).

name: Mew
flavorText: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Choose an evolved Pokemon (your own or your opponent's). Return the highest Stage Evolution card on that Pokemon to its player's hand. That Pokemon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned, or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).

name: Meowth
flavorText: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage. If tails and if your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, he or she chooses 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Eevee
evolvesTo: Vaporeon, Jolteon, Flareon, Sylveon, Espeon, Umbreon, Leafeon, Glaceon
flavorText: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from elemental stones.
Ability1Text: This power can only be used when a Pokemon evolves. Search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee and attach it to Eevee. This counts as evolving Eevee. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Eevee is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Mewtwo
flavorText: A scientist created this Pokemon after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA engineering experiments.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon and attach it to another of your opponent's Pokemon of your choice.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

name: Venusaur
flavorText: This plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Your Active Pokemon and the Defending Pokemon are no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Remove a number of damage counters from Venusaur equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Venusaur has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

name: Mewtwo
flavorText: Years of genetic experiments resulted in the creation of this never-before-seen violent Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Choose up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Mewtwo.

name: Cool Porygon
flavorText: A Pokemon that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.
Attack1Text: You may change Cool Porygon's Resistance to a type of your choice other than Colorless. If the Defending Pokemon has a Weakness, you may change it to a type of your choice other than Colorless. (Benching either Pokemon ends the effect on that Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Dark Persian
flavorText: Popular with women because of its beautiful fur. The leader of the Rockets keeps one as a pet.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon and switch it with the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. if heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Team Rocket's Meowth
flavorText: This Pokemon is more active at night. It likes bright, shiny things and cannot resist taking them and adding them to its collection.
Attack1Text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Pokemon in play. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. Then Team Rocket's Meowth does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

name: Sabrina's Abra
Attack2Text: This attack can't be used unless Sabrina's Abra and the Defending Pokemon have the same number of Energy cards attached to them.

name: Psyduck
flavorText: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokemon will use psychokinetic powers.
Attack1Text: Your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Moltres
flavorText: The flames on this legendary Pokemon's wings burn so brightly that they can make night seem like day.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Moltres. If tails, discard all Energy cards attached to Moltres. If you can't discard Energy cards, this attack does nothing.

name: Articuno
flavorText: This legendary Pokemon is said to freeze the water in the air during winter, causing snow.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Zapdos
flavorText: This legendary Pokemon is said to be present wherever there is a lightning storm.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, and if your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

name: _____'s Pikachu
Attack1Text: If it's not your birthday, this attack does 30 damage. If it is your birthday, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

name: Flying Pikachu
flavorText: By learning how to fly, Pikachu overcame its weakness to Fighting Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Flying Pikachu; if tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

name: Pikachu
flavorText: It uses its sensitive tail to sense its environment and has been known to react violently if its tail is grabbed.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Pikachu.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: When several of these Pokemon gather, their electricity can cause lightning storms.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Pikachu.

name: Surfing Pikachu
flavorText: One summer, a group of Pikachus was found riding the waves at the local beach.

name: Marill
flavorText: The tip of its tail, which contains oil that is lighter than water, lets it swim without drowning.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Marill but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

name: Togepi
flavorText: Still only a hatchling, it uses poison to chase off its enemies when threatened.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon attacks Togepi during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Togepi is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokemon ends this effect.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. Mini-Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else in order to use that attack.) (No matter what type the Defending Pokemon is, Togepi's type is still Colorless.) Togepi performs that attack.

name: Cleffa
flavorText: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.

name: Smeargle
flavorText: Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a type (other than Colorless) and put a Coloring counter on the Defending Pokemon. That Pokemon is now the type you chose. If it already had a Coloring counter, remove the old one. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Scizor
flavorText: Its wings are not used for flying. They are flapped at high speed to adjust its body temperature.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't attack Scizor during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokemon ends this effect.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

name: Entei
flavorText: Volcanoes erupt when it barks. Unable to restrain its extreme power, it races headlong around the land.
Ability1Text: Whenever your opponent's attack damages Entei, unless that attack Knocks Out Entei, flip a coin. If heads, shuffle Entei and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power can't be used if Entei is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when it is damaged.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to your Benched Pokemon.

name: Pichu
flavorText: It is not yet skilled at storing electricity. It may send out a jolt if amused or startled.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Baby Pokemon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

name: Igglybuff
flavorText: Its extremely flexible and elastic body makes it bounce continuouslyâ€”anytime, anywhere.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Hitmontop
flavorText: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokemon, then, if you have any Benched Pokemon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokemon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokemon.)

name: Unown [J]
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown [J], Unown [O], Unown [I], and Unown Dragon on your Bench, you may search your deck for a Basic Pokemon or Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Misdreavus
flavorText: It loves to bite and yank people's hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.
Attack1Text: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokemon for each damage counter on Misdreavus.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Machamp
flavorText: Using its amazing muscles, it throws powerful punches that can knock its victim clear over the horizon.
Attack1Text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on Machamp. This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokemon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokemon.)

name: Magmar
flavorText: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.
Attack1Text: When you use this attack, you may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to your Pokemon in play. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Fire Energy card you discarded in this way.

name: Scyther
flavorText: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.
Attack1Text: Scyther can't use this attack during your next turn. (Benching or evolving Scyther ends this effect.)

name: Electabuzz
flavorText: Normally found near power plants, it can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon and put a Lightning Rod marker on it. (A Pokemon can have only 1 Lightning Rod marker on it at a time.)
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage to any Pokemon with a Lightning Rod marker on it. Apply Weakness and Resistance.

name: Mew
flavorText: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mew by Evolved Pokemon. You can't use this power if Mew is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Articuno
flavorText: A legendary bird Pokemon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.
Ability1Text: As long as Articuno is your Active Pokemon, your Benched Pokemon do not take damage from and are not affected by attacks. This power cannot be used if Articuno is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Snorlax
flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.
Ability1Text: As long as Snorlax is your Active Pokemon, the Defending Pokemon can't Retreat. This power stops working when Snorlax is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Snorlax is now Asleep. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Celebi
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Rapidash
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them. Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Ho-oh
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 60.

name: Suicune
Ability1Text: To attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Suicune, you must discard an Energy card attached to Suicune. (Attach the Water Energy, and then discard an Energy card from Suicune.)
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
